name: General Waterproofing
Membrane system & methodology checked off Against Aland standard
Surface preparation as per application guide
Substrate clean, dry & free from dust
Ensure all floor wastes & pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
Carry out dry film thickness test using positector coating thickness inspection instrument
Final sign off - All general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
External Facade
Hebel Work
Ensure hebel installed plumb & level with adjoining surfaces
Ensure gap between hebel & concrete 10‐15mm (max) & consistent
Ensure hebel panels are in full & not cracked
Final sign off - All hebel work completed as per the above ITP
Render Work
Ensure to use right dulux product & system as per specification & scope of works
Expansion cuts are consistent up & down & to substrate & also same cut thickness
Ensure surfaces flat & level & free of imperfections
Once render applied ‐ render allowed to sufficiently dry before primer coat
Primer Coat ‐ even consistent coverage on render
Membrane Texture Coat ‐ consistent coverage & texture, no roller marks, consistent sheen level
Paint thickness test to be carried out & report to be crossed checked DGain Alands external render & paint specification schedule
Final sign off - All render work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
Formwork & Reinforcing
Formwork
Confirm Class of formwork to all faces, as per the latest specifications
Confirm RL's of soffit & beams
Confirm any penetration sizing for any hoist/crane penetrations
Ensure formwork frames installed to enable clear & labelled access under deck for other personnel & for inspections
Ensure all formwork surfaces are cleaned & no rubbish remains on any soffits,sides,base of work
Ensure bases of all columns/walls are cleaned out prior to pouring
Check formwork is completed as per specified Class
Ensure no rubbish or excess water is present prior to concrete pour
Reinforcing
Size and type correct to specification
Reinforcing spacing and location correct
Specified covers checked/correct
Reinforcing installed correctly to specification and ready for concrete to be placed
Post concrete pour
Formwork stripped in a safe manner
All timbers de - nailed
Final sign off - All formwork & reinforcement completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed
Floor Wastes
Plumber checks all pipes for any cracks, or imperfections
Plumber completes stack work
Plumber cuts waste flush with concrete and puts sponge inside
Plumber caps off all other pipes
Waterproofer pushes sponge down 100mm and finishes his membrane & flood test
Waterproofer removes sponge and releases water and puts the sponge back in ensuring there are no debris left in the pipe
Tiler accepts that the waste is clean and has a sponge in it
Tiler completes his works (ie sand cement & tile)
Aland cleans and removes the sponge
Final sign off - All floor wastes completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed

Courtyard Surfaces ITP
Waterproofing
Confirm area of work is accessible & acceptable to commence (If not comment below)
Setout & alignment as per drawing (include revision below)
Drawing & revision number(s)
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Attach relevant photos below
Membrane system & methodology checked off AGainst Aland standard
Surface preparation as per application guide
Substrate clean, dry & free from dust
Ensure no high points or crevices are in the substrate
Ensure substrate is structurally sound & ready to receive membrane
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer
HOLDPOINT - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Ensure all floor wastes & pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
(PrimeSeal MC to all surfaces at a rate of 3‐4m2/Ltr ‐Alternative primers Multiseal ‐ Primeseal SP at a rate of 5‐8 m2/Ltr)
All corners, joints, gaps & cracks to be treated with a flexible polyurethane sealant resiflex FC
Apply selected Membrane as per datasheet & application guidelines Ensure sealant has fully cured before installing membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat
First coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per DURAM recommendations
Note A total dry film thickness of min 12mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats As such at min
Wet Film Thickness of min 075mm (750 microns) per coat is required ‐ Apply membrane at a coverage of 075 ‐ 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
Allowing the membrane coat to dry min 12 hours check the tackiness before applying next coat
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to second coat
Second coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per DURAM recommendations
Note ‐ a total dry film thickness of min 12mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats As such at min
Wet Film Thickness of min 075mm (750 microns) per coat is required ‐ Apply membrane at a coverage of 075 ‐ 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
The membrane is to be applied in a minimum of 2 coats at a total coverage of 12 to 2 litres per m2 or relevant product TDS 12 to 2 litres per m2 or relevant product TDS
Allow 2nd coat of Multithane UV min 12 hours but no longer than 24 hours before installing Multithane ATC top coat
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to final coat
Apply final coat of Multithane ATC at a coverage rate of 3 ‐ 4 m2/ltr
Carry out dry film thickness test using positector coating thickness inspection instrument
Final sign off - All general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
HOLDPOINT - Once all above items have been signed off work may proceed

Pebble surface installed to specification(s) - Correct level and finish

Mandatory Inspections
Consent
DA/CDC No
CC No
The Following are Critical Stage Mandatory Inspections - They are required pursuant to Section 65 (b) of the Act & Clause 162A of the Regs
In the case of a class 2, 3 or 4 building
(a) after the excavation for, and prior to the placement of, any footing, and

(b) prior to covering of fire protection at service penetrations to building elements that are required to resist internal fire or smoke spread, inspection of a minimum of one of each type of protection method for each type of service, on each storey of the building comprising the building work, and prior to covering the junction of any internal fire-resisting constructions bounding a sole-occupancy unit, and any other building element required to resist internal fire spread, inspection of a minimum of 30% of sole-occupancy units on each storey of the building containing sole-occupancy units, and
(c) prior to the covering of waterproofing in any wet areas, for a minimum of 10% of rooms with wet areas, and
(d) prior to covering any stormwater drainage connections, and
(e) after the building work has been completed and prior to any occupation certificate

Surface preparation as per application guide
Substrate clean, structurally sound & ready to receive membrane
All corners, joints, gaps & cracks to be treated with a flexible polyurethane sealant Resiflex FC ‐apply selected Membrane as per datasheet & application guidelines
Ensure sealant has fully cured before installing membrane

HOLDPOINT - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Ensure all floor wastes & pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
PrimeSeal MC to all surfaces at a rate of 3‐4m2/Ltr
Alternative primers Multiseal ‐ Primeseal SP at a rate of 5‐8 m2/Ltr
Balustrade base i.e. shoe base or angle base installed & grouted with structural grout (as required)
Joint between bottom of base & substrate to be no greater than 10mm
Overflow at the ends of balustrades in place
Approximate width of over floor to be 50mm
Height of overflow must be lower than the bottom of subsill
Angle to be installed between end of base & wall with top of angle to be at FFL
First coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per DURAM recommendations
Note ‐ a total dry film thickness of min 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats. As such at min. Wet Film Thickness of min 0.75mm (750 microns) per coat is required
Apply membrane at a coverage of 0.75 ‐ 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
Allow the membrane coat to dry min 12 hours check the tackiness before applying next coat
Ensure humidity, temperature & moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to second coat
Second coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per DURAM recommendations
Note ‐ a total dry film thickness of 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats. As such at min. Wet Film Thickness of 0.75mm per coat is required
Apply membrane at a coverage of 0.75 ‐ 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
The membrane is to be applied in a minimum of 2 coats at a total coverage of 1.2 to 2 litres per m2. or relevant product TDS
Allow 2nd coat of Multithane UV min. 12 hours BUT no longer than 24 hours before installing Multithane ATC top coat
